result.execSummary:
The defendant Everett J Hembrook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Give False Alarm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.13.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: 22CM1391

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

3:33 PM Defendant Everett J Hembrook in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Everett J Hembrook.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
1 Year Jail - Straight time.  CONSECUTIVE to 22CF1263 and 22CM1182

COSTS: $ 243.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid as a condition of probation in 22CF1263.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
